page.title: Shaikha Noora bint Khalifa Al Khalifa

revision.comment: /* Education */
revision.text:
{{Multiple issues| {{Orphan|date=August 2015}} {{BLP sources|date=March 2015}} {{Underlinked|date=January 2017}} }}
'''Shaikha Noora Bint Khalifa Al Khalifa''' is a [[Bahrain]]i entrepreneurs and businesswoman , founder of; -Medpoint design ,event and consultancy SPC, The eight printing house ,The nine training Center, also the chairman of the news paper 'Bahrain This Week' , karyli tv , Argan perfume bahrain,representing image info Bahrain ,board member in dream gold and Dimond bahrain , Gambit Cunstruction , Gambit foods group, in 2017 she invested in security bussnise cctv united risk management from italy and only info cctv company from Korea . She is a member of the Royal Family of Bahrain, an art enthusiast and a passionate voice for the youth energy of the Middle East.
Born in Bahrain, Riffa in 1987, residing in Bahrain whilst She concentrate on main aim; building the Medpoint business group .
She stand to influence the way the youth think and to build the best training in the Middle East, to evolve the economy and the Western world by Bringing event inspiring speakers and working alongside them. Medpoint invests in a broad range of projects: from youth to women, focusing on fashion branding events and marketing for start-ups to big companies, aligning with the developing needs of the region.In 2015 she was elected as the national brand ambassador of the International Non-Olympic University.<ref name="INOU">{{cite web | url=http://www.bna.bh/portal/en/news/658706 | title=Shaikha Noora appointed NBA ambassador | publisher=Bahrain News Agency | date=14 March 2015 | accessdate=6 January 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.tradearabia.com/news/HEAL_280668.html | title=Parkinson's patient from Bahrain conquers Kilimanjaro | date=27 April 2015 | accessdate=6 January 2016}}</ref> Khalifa is also the CEO & Chair Woman of Medpoint Design, a design company based in Kingdom of Bahrain.<ref name=MPD>{{cite web | url=http://www.bna.bh/portal/en/news/699977 | title=Labour minister patronises forum | publisher=Bahrain News Agency | date=6 December 2015 | accessdate=6 January 2016}}</ref>
== Education == Al Khalifa completed a bachelor's degree in graphic design at the [[New York Institute of Technology]]. She has a master's degree in mass communication and public relations from Al-Ahliya university, Bahrain. PHD in Bussnise administrators
<ref>{{cite web | url=http://inou-edu.org/bamessage.html | title=National Brand Ambassador-NBA (INOU Peace Mission) | publisher=International Non-Olympic University | accessdate=6 January 2016}}</ref>
== Career == Al Khalifa is the national brand ambassador of the International Non-Olympic University which is associated with the international Nobel Peace Prize Recommendation Forum, International Super Cricket Committee, World Sports Karate Federation and World Council for Regular and Distance Education.<ref name="INOU"/> She is also the [[Chief executive officer|CEO]] & Chair Woman of Bahriani design company Medpoint Design.<ref name=MPD/>
She is a member of a number of organizations including, the Al-Khalida Society, the European Bahraini Society, the Bahrain Chamber of Commerce and the society of business women.
Al Khalifa worked as a volunteer lecturer as part of the Enjaz programme with Bahrain University and the Ministry of Education. As the CEO of Medpoint Design she organized the 4th Abaya Exhibition, which was held to support young women and help develop their skills. The exhibition was attended by Princess Sahab bint Abdulla bin Abdulaziz Al Saud who praised the event and thank Al Khalifa for her efforts.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.bna.bh/portal/en/news/583279 | title=HRH Princess Sahab praises 4th Abay Exhibition | publisher=Bahrain News Agency | date=7 October 2013 | accessdate=6 January 2016}}</ref>
== Awards == Al Kalifa has won a number of awards including: *The "Emerging CEO of the year 2015" Award from the 6th Middle East Business Leaders.<ref>[http://www.rougemagz.com/2015/03/09/%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B4%D9%8A%D8%AE%D8%A9-%D9%86%D9%88%D8%B1%D8%A9-%D8%A2%D9%84-%D8%AE%D9%84%D9%8A%D9%81%D8%A9-%D8%A3%D8%A8%D8%B1%D8%B2-%D8%B4%D8%AE%D8%B5%D9%8A%D9%87-%D9%84%D8%B9%D8%A7%D9%85-2015/ Press release]</ref> * The "Emerging CEO of the year 2014" Award from the 5th Middle East Business Leaders. *The University of Bahrain Shield honored for supporting the third form Architecture. * The "Best Supporting organizations in Municipality Works" award, 2014/Bahrain. * An award for the "Young Bahraini Entrepreneurs" from Supreme Council of Women (SCW)'s President, Her Royal Highness Princess Sabeeka bint Ibrahim Al Khalifa.
== References == {{Reflist}}

{{Infobox person |name = Timur Kulibayev |birth_name = Timur Askarovich Kulibayev |image = Timur Kulibayev.jpg |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1966|09|10|df=y}} |birth_place = [[Almaty]], [[Kazakh Soviet Socialist Republic|Kazakh SSR]], [[Soviet Union|USSR]] |nationality = [[Kazakhstan]] |alma_mater=[[Moscow State University]] |children = son Altay (1990), daughters Deniza (2004) and Alishya (2010). | networth = {{increase}}[[United States dollar|US$]]2.1 billion (2015) |spouse=Dinara Nazarbayeva }}
'''Timur Asqaruly Kulibayev''' (also '''Qulybaev'''; {{lang-kk|Тимур Асқарұлы Құлыбаев}}; {{lang-ru|Тиму́р Аска́рович Кулиба́ев}}, born 10 September 1966) is a [[Kazakhs]]tani [[business oligarch]] and son-in-law of Kazakh president [[Nursultan Nazarbayev]]. Kulibayev has held several positions in important state-owned enterprises that manage Kazakhstan's natural resources, and has immense influence over the country's [[hydrocarbon]] industry.<ref name=oil>[http://oilandglory.com/2007_08_01_archive.html "The Kazakhs Want Control"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080123213747/http://oilandglory.com/2007_08_01_archive.html |date=2008-01-23 }}, oilandglory.com; accessed 23 February 2015.</ref><ref name=oil2>[http://labels/Aliyev.html "A Window Into a First Family's Oil Holdings"]{{dead link|date=March 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}, oilandglory.com; accessed 23 February 2015.</ref><ref name=CNNM>[http://money.cnn.com/news/newsfeeds/articles/djf500/200809041004DOWJONESDJONLINE000634_FORTUNE5.htm Kashagan First Oil Now Seen In 2014] CNN Money</ref>
He is the former Chairman of the Management Board of [[Samruk-Kazyna]] National Welfare Fund and a member of the Board of Directors of the [[Gazprom]] company.<ref name=sri2>{{cite web|url=http://www.samruk-kazyna.kz/page.php?page_id=2749&lang=3&parent_id=2731/2011/09/21|title=Samruk-Kazyna official website, Management Board Information|publisher=Samruk-kazyna.kz|accessdate=23 February 2015}}</ref> As of October 2017, he was listed as the third richest man in Kazakhstan and the 973rd richest in the world with a fortune of $2.3 billion.<ref>https://www.forbes.com/profile/timur-kulibaev/</ref> Kulibayev has been called "the most important business figure in the resource-rich" Republic of Kazakhstan by [[The Daily Telegraph]].<ref name="telegraph">{{cite news|last1=Orange|first1=Richard|title=Timur Kulibayev to head $80bn Kazakh Sovereign wealth fund|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/finance/newsbysector/banksandfinance/8446134/Timur-Kulibayev-to-head-80bn-Kazakh-Sovereign-wealth-fund.html|accessdate=3 October 2015|work=[[The Daily Telegraph]]|date=12 April 2011}}</ref>
==Early life and education== Kulibayev was born on 10 September 1966 in Alma-Ata (now [[Almaty]]), [[Kazakh Soviet Socialist Republic|Kazakh SSR]], [[Soviet Union|USSR]]. In 1988, he graduated from [[Moscow State University|Lomonosov Moscow State University]], majoring in "National Economy Planning", making him an economist by profession. He has a Ph.D. in Economics, and defended a thesis on: "Improvement of Organizational and Economic Mechanism of Enterprise Management in Market Environment (based on the oil industry)" (1999).{{cn|date=August 2017}} He has a number of research publications.{{cn|date=August 2017}} He speaks fluent Kazakh, Russian and English.{{citation needed|date=February 2015}}
==Business career== From 1988 to 1992, he worked as an economist. He was a junior research assistant at the Scientific-Research Economics Institute of Planning and Normative Standards (SREIP&NS) under the State Plan of [[Kazakh Soviet Socialist Republic]], and was a director of the Scientific-Consulting Center of the Fund of Cultural, Social, Scientific and Technological Development of Kazakhstan.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kegoc.kz/en/corporate/board/kulibaev|title=Timur A. Kulibayev|publisher=Kegoc.kz|accessdate=23 February 2015}}</ref>
In 1990, he was the director of the Research and Consultative Center under the Fund for Cultural, Social and Technological Development in Kazakhstan. He headed Altyn-Alma and was Chairman of the Supervisory Board of Almaty Trade and Industry Bank. In 1997 he was appointed as the head of the Directorate for Project Assessment and Negotiating under the Investment Committee of Kazakhstan (exercising rights of the Deputy Chairman).<ref name>{{cite web|url=http://www.samruk-kazyna.kz/page.php?page_id=2749&lang=3&parent_id=2731|title=Самрук-Қазына|publisher=Samruk-kazyna.kz|accessdate=23 February 2015}}</ref>
From May 1997 until March 1999, he was the Vice-President on Economy and Finance of CJSC National Oil and Gas Company Kazkhoil. In March 1999 he became the President of CJSC National Company for Oil Transportation KazTransOil. From May 2001 till February 2002 he was the General Director of CJSC National Company Oil and Gas Transportation (created on the basis of [[KazTransOil]] and KazTransGas). From February 2002 until October 2005 he was the First Vice-President of JSC NC [[KazMunayGas]], a merger of CJSC NC KazakhOil and CJSC NC Oil and Gas Transportation.<ref name="forbes2010">{{cite news|title=The World's Billionaires #880: Timur Kulibaev|url=https://www.forbes.com/lists/2010/10/billionaires-2010_Timur-Kulibaev_9QF5.html|accessdate=3 October 2015|work=[[Forbes]]|date=3 October 2010}}</ref>
After his resignation from the post in KazMunaiGas, he has initiated foundation and headed the Association of Legal Entities Kazakhstan Association of Oil, Gas and Energy Sector Organizations KAZENERGY that united major national and foreign companies, operating in the energy sector of Kazakhstan. At the same time he became part-time Adviser to the President of the Republic of Kazakhstan. In 2005-06 and 2007-08 he combined a public activity with a direct management of his own private business.<ref name="railways1"/><ref name="railways1">{{cite web|url=http://www.railways.kz/en/node/1043|title=Timur Kulibayev | АО "Казахстан Темiр Жолы"|publisher=Railways.kz|accessdate=23 February 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kmg.kz/en/corporate_management/leadership/directors|title=The Board of Directors Authority Corporate Governance Home NC KazMunayGas JSC|publisher=Kmg.kz|accessdate=23 February 2015}}</ref>
From April 2006 till August 2007, he was the Deputy Chairman of the Management Board of JSC Kazakhstan Holding Company for State Assets Management Samruk. Simultaneously he was the Chairman of Board of Directors of JSC KEGOC and NC KazMunaiGas. In October 2008 he became the Deputy Chairman of the Management Board of JSC National Welfare Fund Samruk-Kazyna. He is Chairman of the Boards of Directors of JSC [[Kazatomprom]], JSC NC KazMunayGas, JSC NC [[Qazaqstan Temir Zholy|Kazakhstan TemirZholy]], JSC [[KEGOC|Kazakhstan Company on Power Grid Management]] (KEGOC), JSC Samruk-Energo.{{citation needed|date=February 2015}}
By decree of the [[Government of Kazakhstan|Government of the Republic of Kazakhstan]] #409, on 12 April 2011, he was appointed to the post of the Chairman of the Management Board of JSC NWF Samruk-Kazyna. Based on the voting results by Decree of the Government of the Republic of Kazakhstan #410 of 12 April 2011, he was elected to the membership of the Board of Directors. The election of T.A. Kulibayev to the Board of Directors of the Russian largest energy company shows the particular importance of economic cooperation between Kazakhstan and the Russian Federation, as well as a recognition of high professional qualities of the Chief Executive of Samruk-Kazyna Fund.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://en.tengrinews.kz/kazakhstan_news/825|title=Timur Kulibayev to head Samruk Kazyna|publisher=En.tengrinews.kz|accessdate=23 February 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=Richard Orange|url=http://uk.finance.yahoo.com/news/Timur-Kulibayev-head-80bn-tele-1292706449.html?x=0&.v=1TimurKulibayev|title=to head $80bn Kazakh Sovereign wealth fund|publisher=Uk.finance.yahoo.com|accessdate=23 February 2015}}</ref>
On 26 December 2011, Kulibayev resigned from the post of Chairman of the Board of Samruk-Kazyna.
Since June 2008, he has been Chairman of the Kazakhstan National Committee of the [[World Petroleum Council]].{{citation needed|date=February 2015}}
<u>Public activities:</u>
Since 2004 – honorary member of the Council of Federation of the Republican Public Association “National Federation of Golf of RoK”.
Since 2008 – chairman of Kazakhstan National Committee of World Petroleum Council.
Since 2009 – president of Kazakhstan Boxing Federation.
Since 2010 – a member of the Executive Committee of the National Olympic Committee of RoK.
Since 2011 – chairman of the Board of Trustees of “Arystan” specialized lyceum (Talgar town);
Since 2012 –vice-president, a member of the Executive Committee of International Boxing Association (AIBA).
Since 2012 – chairman of Kazakhstan Confederation of Сombat and Strength Sports.
Since 2014 – a member of the National Olympic Committee.
Since 2014 – chairman of Multi-Sport Games of “SportAccord” International Convention.
Since 2015 – president of the National Olympic Committee of RoK.
Since 2016 - Vice President (Central Asia) of the Olympic Council of Asia (OCA)
==Personal life==
He is married to Dinara Nursultanovna (''née'' Nazarbayeva), daughter of Kazakhstan's long-time president [[Nursultan Nazarbayev]]. They have three children: a son Altay, and daughters Deniza and Alishya.<ref name=IEIEPR>{{cite web|url=http://www.samruk-kazyna.kz/page.php?page_id=2749&lang=3&parent_id=2731|title=Samruk-Kazyna official web site|publisher=Samruk-kazyna.kz|accessdate=23 February 2015}}</ref> He has an additional two [[Natural child|natural children]] with entrepreneur and socialite [[Goga Ashkenazi]], both sons: Adam, born in 2007, and Alan, born in 2012.<ref name="ft2013">{{cite news|last1=Kuper|first1=Simon|title=Lunch with the FT: Goga Ashkenazi|url=http://www.ft.com/intl/cms/s/2/b011a812-d8da-11e2-84fa-00144feab7de.html|accessdate=3 October 2015|work=[[Financial Times]]|date=21 June 2013}}</ref>
Kulibayev is an avid fan of sports, especially [[golf]], and often competes in golf tournaments.<ref name=golf>[http://www.golfkz.kz/archive/iaugust2005 Тимур Кулибаев: Гольф - идеальная игра!] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070912185906/http://www.golfkz.kz/archive/iaugust2005 |date=2007-09-12 }}, Golf.kz {{ru icon}}</ref> He is president of Kazakhstani Boxing Federation.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vecher.kz/?S=19-200901220640|script-title=ru:Президентом федерации избран Тимур Кулибаев - Вечерний Алматы|publisher=Vecher.kz|accessdate=23 February 2005|language=ru}}</ref>
==Awards== Awards of the Republic of Kazakhstan: * Kurmet order (2001) * Barys order of 3-d degree (2009) * Barys order of 1-t degree (2014) * Jubilee medal “The 10-th Anniversary of Kazakhstan Constitution” (2005) * Jubilee medal “The 10-th Anniversary of Astana (2008) * Jubilee medal “The 20-th Anniversary of Independence of RoK” (2011) Awards of the Russian Federation: * “Druzhba” order of the Russian Federation (2007) * “Honorary Railman” medal (2011)
==See also== *[[Jan Bonde Nielsen]]
==References== {{reflist|2}}

revision.text:
{{short description|Russian businessman}} {{for|the Soviet Olympic sprinter|Vasily Anisimov (athlete)}} {{Use dmy dates|date=June 2017}} {{Infobox person | name = Vasily Anisimov | image = | image_size = | caption = | birth_name = Vasily V. Anisimov | birth_date = {{birth based on age as of date |65|2017|05|21|df=y}}<ref name="forbes1"/> | birth_place = | death_date = | death_place = | death_cause = | restingplace = | nationality = Russian | residence = [[Moscow]], Russia | education = | alma mater = | occupation = property developer | title = | term = | predecessor = | successor = | known for = | boards = | salary = | networth = US$1.49 billion (May 2017)<ref name="forbes1">{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/profile/vasily-anisimov/ |title=Vasily Anisimov |publisher=Forbes.com |accessdate=21 May 2017}}</ref> | spouse = Galina Anisimova (divorced) | children = 4 | parents = | relations = | website = }}
'''Vasily V. Anisimov''' (born 1951/52) is a Russian [[billionaire]] businessman. In the 1990s, he owned banks and aluminium plants, sold everything in 2000, and is now a property developer.
==Early life== Gordeev has a bachelor's degree from the Alma-Ata Institute of National Economy.<ref name="forbes1"/>
==Career== From 1986 to 1989, he served as general director of a Moscow-based hardware wholesaler, Roskhoztorg. In the 1990s, he owned banks and aluminium plants - Metalloinvest. In 2000, after being sued by fellow Russian billionaire [[Mikhail Khodorkovsky]], Anisimv liquidated most of his assets.<ref>{{cite web|author1=Frik Els |url=http://www.mining.com/2012-mining-billionaires-34-vasily-anisimov-35-alexander-nesis-36-igor-zyuzin-37-patokh-chodiev-38-alijan-ibragimov-39-alexander-machkevich-40-daniel-mate-and-aristotelis-mistakidis/ |title=2012 Mining Billionaires: #34 Vasily Anisimov, #35 Alexander Nesis, #36 Igor Zyuzin, #37 Patokh Chodiev, #38 Alijan Ibragimov, #39 Alexander Machkevich, #40 Daniel Mate, #41 Aristotelis Mistakidis |publisher=MINING.com |date=15 April 2012 |accessdate=17 June 2017}}</ref> By 2004 Anismimov re-emerged as a co-owner of Metalloinvest with fellow billionaires Alisher Usmanov and Andrei Skoch.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.albawaba.com/business/secret-dealings-of-swiss-lawyer-dieter-neupert-922326#comment-form-title |title=The Secret Dealings of Swiss Lawyer Dieter Neupert |publisher=Al Bawaba |date=5 January 2017 |accessdate=17 June 2017}}</ref> From here he switched form Russian mines to realeste.<ref name="forbes1"/> His wealth comes from investments in [[Metalloinvest]] and his real estate company Coalco.<ref name="businessinsider.com">{{cite web|url=http://uk.businessinsider.com/the-most-eligible-russian-billionaires-in-the-world-2016-7/#t-10-vasily-anisimov-3|title=The 11 richest Russian men who are still single|publisher=}}</ref>
He is a friend of [[Arkady Rotenberg]], and is the head of the Russian Judo Federation.<ref name="therealdeal1">{{cite web|last=Putzier |first=Konrad |url=https://therealdeal.com/2015/05/13/russian-oligarchs-ex-pays-20m-for-carlton-house-co-op/ |title=Carlton House | Galina Anisimova | Vasily Anisimov |publisher=Therealdeal.com |date=13 May 2015 |accessdate=21 May 2017}}</ref><ref name="businessinsider.com"/>
==Personal life== Anisimov was married to Galina Anisimova, and has four children.<ref name="therealdeal1"/><ref name="forbes1"/> Their daughter, Galina, was murdered with her husband, Alexander Nalimov, both found "bound and killed execution-style," in their [[Ekaterinburg]] home in 2000.<ref>[http://old.themoscowtimes.com/sitemap/free/2000/4/article/metals-magnates-in-85b-merger/264102.html McChesney, Andrew] "Metals Magnates In $8.5B Merger", ''The Moscow Times'', April 18, 2000. Retrieved October 16, 2018.</ref><ref>[http://nymag.com/nymetro/news/people/features/9873/index2.html Eaton, Pheobe] "How Much Is That In Rubles?", ''New York'', June 2012. Retrieved October 16, 2018.</ref> Another daughter, Galina's half-sister, Anna Anisimova, is a socialite and ex-model who has been called the "Russian-American Paris Hilton".<ref name="therealdeal1"/>
He lives in [[Moscow]], Russia,<ref name="forbes1"/> and sometimes in [[New York City|New York]].
==References== {{Reflist}}

revision.text:
{{ad|date=August 2018}} {{Infobox company| name = Xchanging - DXC Technology Company| logo = [[File:Xchanging BM rgb.jpg|200px]]| type = [[Public company|Public]] ({{lse|XCH}})| | foundation = 1999| | location = [[London]], United Kingdom| | key_people = Geoff Unwin ([[Chairman]])
Craig Wilson ([[CEO]])
David Bauernfeind ([[CFO]]) | | num_employees = 7,000 (2015){{cite web|url=http://www.xchanging.com/documents/Final_booklet_28April09.pdf|title=Download Area|work=Xchanging plc|accessdate=13 May 2016}}| | industry = [[Technology]] | revenue = [[Pound sterling|£]]440.2 million (2015){{cite web|url=http://www.xchanging.com/system/files/uploads/financialdocs/1XchangingAR2012fullreduced.pdf|title=Xchanging - Business Processing, Procurement and Technology Services Provider|work=Xchanging plc|accessdate=13 May 2016}}| | parent = [[DXC Technology]] | homepage = [http://www.xchanging.com www.xchanging.com] | }} '''Xchanging''' is a business process and technology services provider and integrator, owned by [[DXC Technology]], with a wide range of multinational customers across many industries in 48 countries. Xchanging provides technology-enabled business solutions to the global commercial insurance industry. In outsourcing, Xchanging will typically take over a customer's business process, or back office function, and incorporate them into an existing platform in an attempt to provide better and cheaper handling of administrative tasks.[http://www.xchanging.com/InvestorRelations/documents/Xchanging_annual_report_2009_website_25March10.pdf Annual Report 2009] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100414131951/http://www.xchanging.com/InvestorRelations/documents/Xchanging_annual_report_2009_website_25March10.pdf |date=April 14, 2010 }}, page 4 Xchanging employs over 7,000 people worldwide.{{cite web|url=http://www.xchanging.com/investing-xchanging|title=Investing in Xchanging|work=Xchanging plc|accessdate=13 May 2016}} Xchanging offers IT outsourcing, infrastructure including network managed services, software products and application management. It also sells [[procurement]] services. It was listed on the [[London Stock Exchange]] until it was acquired by [[Computer Sciences Corporation|CSC]] in May 2016. Now owned by [[DXC Technology]] ==History== Xchanging was founded in 1999, by David Andrews, a former partner in [[Andersen Consulting]]. Andrews came up with the idea at Andersen Consulting, to create joint ventures with large multinationals to outsource the processing of back-office transactions.[http://www.globalservicesmedia.com/Strategies-and-Best-Practices/Global-Sourcing/The-Power-of-Partnerships/24/47/0/general200705211356 The Power of Partnerships] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110711102358/http://www.globalservicesmedia.com/Strategies-and-Best-Practices/Global-Sourcing/The-Power-of-Partnerships/24/47/0/general200705211356 |date=July 11, 2011 }} In 2000, Xchanging and [[BAE Systems]] created the first of these 'Enterprise Partnerships',[http://www.carig.co.uk/pages/userdata/carig/bpoenterprisepartnership_teb.pdf BPO Enterprise Partnerships] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120312225716/http://www.carig.co.uk/pages/userdata/carig/bpoenterprisepartnership_teb.pdf |date=March 12, 2012 }} for HR services (see also{{cite web|url=http://www.prnewswire.co.uk/cgi/news/release?id=188248|title=Xchanging Acquires BAE Systems' Remaining 50% Share in Jointly Owned HR Services Company|author=Xchanging UK Limited|date=17 January 2007|publisher=|accessdate=13 May 2016}}). A second followed soon after, again with BAE Systems, for indirect procurement.{{cite web|url=http://www.xchanging.com/Media/PressRelease.aspx?ID=67|title=News|work=Xchanging plc|accessdate=13 May 2016}} In 2012, Xchanging entered the US Indirect Procurement market through an agreement with U.S. based [[BAE Systems]] representing $800 million in spend to be addressed over 7 years.{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2011/08/17/idUS168170+17-Aug-2011+BW20110817|title=Xchanging and BAE Systems Inc Sign Seven Year US Procurement Outsourcing Services Contract|author=Reuters Editorial|date=17 August 2011|work=Reuters|accessdate=13 May 2016}} Two years later, Xchanging and [[Lloyd's of London]] created two more 'Enterprise Partnerships',[http://www.lloyds.com/Lloyds/Press-Centre/Press-Releases/2001/11/Lloyds_and_Xchanging_announce_deal_to_commercialise_Lloyds_claims_office Lloyd's Press Release] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110928120606/http://www.lloyds.com/Lloyds/Press-Centre/Press-Releases/2001/11/Lloyds_and_Xchanging_announce_deal_to_commercialise_Lloyds_claims_office |date=September 28, 2011 }} one for claims processing, and one for the London Insurance market's back office system; the latter including the IUA{{cite web|url=http://www.iua.co.uk/AM/Template.cfm?Section=Home |title=IUA of London |accessdate=13 May 2016 |deadurl=unfit |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070626095602/http://www.iua.co.uk/AM/Template.cfm?Section=Home |archivedate=June 26, 2007 }} as a partner too. Further partnerships were signed with [[Deutsche Bank]]{{cite web|url=http://www.finextra.com/news/fullstory.aspx?newsitemid=11910|title=Xchanging takes majority stake in Deutsche Bank transaction subsidi...|work=Finextra Research|accessdate=13 May 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://annualreport.deutsche-bank.com/2004/ar/supplementaryinformations/corporategovernancereport/reportingandtransparency/relatedpartytransactions/transactionsxchanging.html|title=Deutsche Bank Annual Report 2004 - Transactions Xchanging|publisher=|accessdate=13 May 2016}} in 2004 (launching Xchanging into the European financial market), [[Aon Corporation|Aon]] in 2006 (in broking services){{cite web|url=http://www.insurancejournal.com/news/international/2006/08/14/71401.htm|title=Aon Outsources London Market Processing Operations to Xchanging|date=14 August 2006|work=Insurance Journal|accessdate=13 May 2016}} and [[Allianz|Allianz GI]]{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/finance/markets/2814592/Xchanging-in-270m-Allianz-deal.html|title=Xchanging in £270m Allianz deal|author=Sophie Brodie|date=24 August 2007|work=Telegraph.co.uk|accessdate=13 May 2016}}[http://www.globalservicesmedia.com/News/Home/Allianz-in-$600-Mn-Outsourcing-Deal-with-Xchanging/21/27/0/general200708232712 Allianz Outsoucring Deal] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110711102429/http://www.globalservicesmedia.com/News/Home/Allianz-in-$600-Mn-Outsourcing-Deal-with-Xchanging/21/27/0/general200708232712 |date=July 11, 2011 }}[http://www.allianzglobalinvestors.com/en/aboutus/GlobalPresence/Europe/PresenceInGermany/Pages/FondsDepotBank.aspx Allianz Press release] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120301203614/http://www.allianzglobalinvestors.com/en/aboutus/GlobalPresence/Europe/PresenceInGermany/Pages/FondsDepotBank.aspx |date=March 1, 2012 }} in 2007. In 2007{{cite web|url=http://www.xchanging.com/Media/PressRelease.aspx?ID=113|title=News|work=Xchanging plc|accessdate=13 May 2016}} Xchanging listed on the London Stock Exchange, entering the FTSE250.[https://www.theguardian.com/business/2002/jan/01/baesystemsbusiness The Guardian]{{cite web|url=http://www.insurancejournal.com/news/international/2007/03/27/78130.htm|title=Xchanging Prepares IPO|date=27 March 2007|work=Insurance Journal|accessdate=13 May 2016}} In 2009, Xchanging acquired a 75% stake in [[Cambridge Solutions]],{{cite web|url=http://articles.economictimes.indiatimes.com/2008-10-05/news/27699657_1_cambridge-solutions-ramesh-vangal-share-capital|title=Xchanging to acquire Cambridge for 83 mn pounds|date=5 October 2008|publisher=Economic Times|accessdate=13 May 2016}} another outsourcing business. This acquisition was to deliver greater scale, broader international reach, and a number of platforms for future growth.{{cite web|url=http://www.finextra.com/news/announcement.aspx?pressreleaseid=23766|title=Xchanging acquires 75% stake in Cambridge Solutions|work=Finextra Research|accessdate=13 May 2016}} In 2010,{{cite web|url=http://www.xchanging.com/Media/PressRelease.aspx?ID=201|title=News|work=Xchanging plc|accessdate=13 May 2016}} Xchanging further expanded in the European financial sector by developing an eighth 'Enterprise Partnership' with [[Italy|Italian]] group, [[SIA S.p.A.|SIA-SSB]].{{cite web|url=http://www.finextra.com/news/announcement.aspx?pressreleaseid=35043|title=Xchanging completes SIA-SSB deal|work=Finextra Research|accessdate=13 May 2016}} As part of this 'Enterprise Partnership', Xchanging acquired 51% of Kedrios S.p.A. (Kedrios), the Italian subsidiary of SIA-SSB that specialises in securities processing and fund administration services for the Italian market. With this, Xchanging entered the Italian market. This market is one of the larger outsourcing markets in [[Europe]].{{cite web|url=https://www.theregister.co.uk/2007/07/13/outsourcing_demand_rises/|title=Europe goes mad over outsourcing|publisher=|accessdate=13 May 2016}} In mid 2010, Xchanging acquired security and technology communications company, Data Integration.{{cite web|url=http://www.proactiveinvestors.co.uk/companies/news/17901/xchanging-snaps-up-network-security-business-data-integration-for-up-to-9-million-17901.html|title=Xchanging snaps up network security business Data Integration for up to £9 million|date=21 June 2010|work=Proactiveinvestors UK|accessdate=13 May 2016}} The company{{cite web|url=http://www.dataintegration.com/|title=Data Integration|work=Data Integration|accessdate=13 May 2016}} is an IT services business in the United Kingdom. The company specialises in network security, application optimisation, mobility services, high performance networks, IP telephony and open access networks. Data Integration serves more than 300 customers in the UK, spanning the private and public sectors. Based on a number of long-term Enterprise Partnerships and the acquisition of Cambridge Solutions, Xchanging reported a 35% revenue increase year-on-year to £750.4m, at the end of 2009.{{cite web|url=http://markets.ft.com/tearsheets/financialsSummary.asp?s=XCH:LSE|title=Xchanging PLC, XCH:LSE financials - FT.com|publisher=|accessdate=13 May 2016}} On 8 February 2011, Xchanging issued a profit warning and announced a £100 million write-off on goodwill. David Andrews stepped down with immediate effect and became "senior adviser to the chairman", Ken Lever assumed the role of Acting Chief Executive Officer in addition to his role as CFO.{{cite journal|url=https://www.theguardian.com/business/marketforceslive/2011/feb/09/xchanging-halves-profit-warning|title=Outsourcing group Xchanging halves in value after profit warning|first=Nick|last=Fletcher|journal=The Guardian}}{{cite web|url=http://online.hemscottir.com/ir/xch/ir.jsp?page=news-item&item=583915836314522|title=Xchanging PLC - Trading Statement|publisher=|accessdate=13 May 2016}} On ''' '''3 July 2014, Xchanging [http://www.totalobjects.co.uk/p/h/News/Xchanging_Acquires_Total_Objects/332/ acquired] Total Objects Ltd. In May 2016, [[Computer Sciences Corporation|CSC]] acquired Xchanging plc in a deal valued at £480 million, or approximately US$720 million.{{Cite web | url = http://www.csc.com/newsroom/press_releases/135745-csc_makes_cash_offer_for_xchanging_plc | title = CSC Makes Cash Offer for Xchanging Plc. | website = Computer Sciences Corporation | language = en-US | access-date = 2016-02-25 }} ===Notable partners and customers=== Xchanging's partners include [[Lloyd's of London]], [[Deutsche Bank]], [[Allianz AG]], [[Aon plc|Aon]] and SIA-SSB. Other notable partnerships that Xchanging has developed include deals with CAD IT{{cite web|url=http://www.prnewswire.co.uk/cgi/news/release?id=189543|title=CAD IT & Xchanging Sign an Exclusive International Partnering Agreement /PR Newswire UK/|author=CAD IT|date=5 February 2007|publisher=|accessdate=13 May 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://www.xchanging.com/Media/PressRelease.aspx?ID=51|title=News|work=Xchanging plc|accessdate=13 May 2016}} in Italy, Alexander Mann Solutions,[http://www.recruiter.co.uk/ams-forms-strategic-alliance-with-xchanging/1002290.article The Recruiter, Alexander Mann Solutions] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111004182418/http://www.recruiter.co.uk/ams-forms-strategic-alliance-with-xchanging/1002290.article |date=October 4, 2011 }} forms strategic alliance with Xchanging]] and [[Pegasystems]].{{cite web|url=http://www.euroinvestor.co.uk/news/story.aspx?id=11051636|title=Latest Financial News, Stock News, Forex News and Commodity Market News - Euroinvestor|publisher=|accessdate=13 May 2016}} Customers include [[Boots UK|Boots]],{{cite web|url=http://www.hroeurope.com/news/3101/xchanging-and-boots-sign-seven-year-400-million-outsourcing-contract|title=You searched for xchanging and boots sign seven year 400 million outsourcing contract - HRO Today|work=HRO Today|accessdate=13 May 2016}} Cooper Gay,{{cite web|url=http://www.coopergay.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=355:cooper-gay-signs-outsourcing-contract-with-xchanging&catid=1:latest-news&Itemid=51|title=Cooper Gay signs outsourcing contract with Xchanging|author=Barbara Hahn|publisher=|accessdate=13 May 2016}} [[CHEP]],{{cite web|url=http://www.xchanging.com/Media/PressRelease.aspx?ID=180|title=News|work=Xchanging plc|accessdate=13 May 2016}} [[SELEX Galileo]],{{cite web|url=http://www.xchanging.com/Media/PressRelease.aspx?ID=179|title=News|work=Xchanging plc|accessdate=13 May 2016}} [[QBE Insurance|QBE]],{{cite web|url=http://www.xchanging.com/Media/PressRelease.aspx?ID=163|title=News|work=Xchanging plc|accessdate=13 May 2016}} [[Birds Eye]],{{cite web|url=http://www.xchanging.com/Media/PressRelease.aspx?ID=136|title=News|work=Xchanging plc|accessdate=13 May 2016}} [[American Express]]{{cite web|url=http://www.crainscleveland.com/article/20090630/FREE/906309966/1003/MAN|title=CrainsCleveland.com : Subscription Center|publisher=|accessdate=13 May 2016}} [[London Metal Exchange]],{{cite web|url=http://www.lme.com/|title=London Metal Exchange: Home|publisher=|accessdate=13 May 2016}} and the [[Liberty Mutual]]{{cite web|url=http://www.xchanging.com/news/press-releases/leading-insurance-broker-marsh-appoints-xuber-to-provide-core-broking-software|title=Leading Insurance Broker Marsh Appoints Xuber to Provide Core Broking Software|work=Xchanging plc|accessdate=13 May 2016}} ==Operations== Xchanging works with large organisations in processing areas such as [[human resources|HR]], [[accountancy|accounting]] and [[procurement outsourcing|procurement]], as well as industry specific processing such as [[security (finance)|securities processing]] and [[insurance|insurance claims processing]]. Although the list of back-office processes which could be transformed is non-exhaustive.[http://www.businessworld.in/bw/2010_07_30_We_Are_Fairly_Industry_Agnostic.html Business World, We are Fairly Industry Agnostic] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100809110433/http://www.businessworld.in/bw/2010_07_30_We_Are_Fairly_Industry_Agnostic.html |date=August 9, 2010 }} Xchanging provides services across industries. *Procurement – Managing direct & indirect spend and sourcing strategies *Finance and accounting - Processing of receipts and payments, net settlement and clearance *Human resources - Providing employment services from recruitment through to payroll and pensions payment, back-to-work and medical compensation schemes *Technology – Design, build and run IT infrastructure and software *Customer administration - B2B and B2C services to support customer's customer Xchanging provides industry specific processing{{cite web|url=http://www.xchanging.com/CustomerSolutions/IndustrySpecificSolutions.html|title=Insurance Claims Management Software Services and Solutions - Xchanging|work=Xchanging plc|accessdate=13 May 2016}} for:- *Banking and securities – Processing securities transactions and retail investment accounting *Insurance – Processing of insurance policies, premiums & claims, and broker annuity *Other financial services - IT systems & hosting for exchanges, processing services for fund managers, investors, as well as [[SWIFT]] managed infrastructure services to banks *Industrial, commercial and public – Including [[retail]], [[real estate]], manufacturing and [[logistics]] as well as services for the [[public sector]] in the United States and [[Asia-Pacific]]. ==Locations== Xchanging has offices in ten principal locations - Australia - Insurance and Procurement, France - RTO and Nasdaq, Italy - Monetary Policy and Compensation, Germany, India, Japan, [[Malaysia]], [[Singapore]], the [[UK]] and the United States.{{cite web|url=http://www.xchanging.com/AboutUs/Ourglobalpresence.html|title=Xchanging Geographic Reach|work=Xchanging plc|accessdate=13 May 2016}} ===Low-Carbon Shimoga Project=== On Prime Minister [[David Cameron]]'s visit to India{{cite web|url=http://www.dnaindia.com/bangalore/report_british-pm-david-cameron-gifts-2000-jobs-to-shimoga_1416102|title=British PM David Cameron gifts 2,000 jobs to Shimoga|date=29 July 2010|work=dna|accessdate=13 May 2016}}{{cite news| url=https://www.theguardian.com/politics/wintour-and-watt/2010/jul/27/davidcameron-india | location=London | work=The Guardian | first=Nicholas | last=Watt | title=David Cameron seeks to impress India with his massive delegation | date=27 July 2010}} in July 2010, CEO David Andrews revealed plans to create a new low-carbon state-of-the-art 1,000 person processing centre{{what|date=August 2018}}, with an option to scale to 2,000, in Shimoga,{{cite web|url=http://www.deccanherald.com/content/84508/sleepy-shimoga-go-global.html|title=Sleepy Shimoga to go global|work=Deccan Herald|accessdate=13 May 2016}} a tier three town,{{cite web|url=http://www.egovmonitor.com/node/37721 |title=Economy |work=EGOV Monitor |accessdate=13 May 2016 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120312091830/http://www.egovmonitor.com/node/37721 |archivedate=March 12, 2012 }} north-west of Bangalore. Speaking on the Shimoga project, British Prime Minister, Mr. David Cameron said, "''I welcome this latest news from David and his team in Karnataka which showcases the very best of UK and Indian ingenuity and creativity. My government is keen to lay the foundations of an enhanced relationship between Britain and India for the decades to come, and Xchanging has demonstrated here in India what can be achieved by British companies of when successfully opening up new markets around the world''"{{cite web|url=http://www.xchanging.com/Media/PressRelease.aspx?ID=199|title=News|work=Xchanging plc|accessdate=13 May 2016}} Chief Minister of Karnataka, Mr. BS [[Yeddyurappa]] stated, "''Entry of a multi-national in Shimoga is an indication of the potential of tier 2 and tier 3 cities of Karnataka. Xchanging's association in joint development of the SEZ IT Park at Shimoga would usher in IT penetration in Tier 2 and Tier 3 cities. I congratulate Xchanging for this initiative''". ==University Boat Race== Xchanging was the title sponsor of the historic, annual [[boat race]] between the [[Oxford University Boat Club|Oxford]] and [[Cambridge University Boat Club|Cambridge]] universities from 2005 until 2012. From the 156th race, held on April 3, 2010, the Boat Race was officially called the ‘Xchanging Boat Race’.{{cite news |newspaper=[[The Daily Telegraph]] |date=20 November 2009 |author=Rachel Quarrell |title=University Boat Race to have title sponsorship from 2010 onwards |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/othersports/rowing/6608733/University-Boat-Race-to-have-title-sponsorship-from-2010-onwards.html |location=London}}{{cite web|title=Xchanging becomes title sponsor of The Boat Race |publisher=The Boat Race Company |url=http://www.theboatrace.org/article/newsandmedia/latestnews/xchangingtitlesponsor |accessdate=2009-11-20 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091121135734/http://www.theboatrace.org/article/newsandmedia/latestnews/xchangingtitlesponsor |archivedate=November 21, 2009 }} The first Xchanging Boat Race, won by Cambridge after a gap of two years, drew record viewership{{cite web|url=http://www.admin.cam.ac.uk/news/dp/2010040802|title=Latest news|work=University of Cambridge|accessdate=13 May 2016}} on television, online and along the [[River Thames]] with thousands of spectators lining the banks. ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} ==External links== * [http://www.xchanging.com Official website] [[Category:Business services companies of the United Kingdom]] [[Category:International business]] [[Category:Companies established in 1999]] [[Category:Companies based in the City of London‎]]
